full_name: Fraction Reads in Squares Under Tissue
alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 75%. Application performance may be affected. Many of the reads were not assigned to tissue covered squares. This could be caused by high levels of ambient RNA resulting from inefficient permeabilization, because the incorrect image was used, or because of poor tissue detection. The latter case can be addressed by using the manual tissue selection option through Loupe. Ignore this alert if you manually selected a subset of the tissue in the capture area, such as a single core punch in a TMA.
alert_warn_name: Low Fraction Gene Expression Reads in Squares
help_description: The fraction of valid-barcode, confidently-mapped-to-probe-set reads with tissue-associated barcodes.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal > 70%. This may indicate a quality issue with the R1 read for the Visium Chemistry. Application performance may be affected.
help_description: Fraction of reads with barcodes that match the whitelist after barcode correction.

alert_warn_detail: Ideal < 20%. High gDNA levels were detected. Confirm that workflow was performed correctly and check tissue block quality.
help_description: The estimated fraction of filtered UMIs derived from genomic DNA based on the discordance between probes targeting exon-junction-spanning regions and non-exon-junction-spanning regions.

alert_warn_detail: Fraction of cell barcode bases (R1 for Single Cell Universal 3' and 5') with Q-score >= 30 should be above 55%. A lower fraction might indicate poor sequencing quality.
alert_warn_name: Fraction of cell barcode bases with Q-score >= 30 is low
help_description: Fraction of cell barcode bases with Q-score >= 30, excluding very low quality/no-call (Q <= 2) bases from the denominator.
The number of unique genes from the filtered probe set with at least one UMI count in any tissue covered square.

The fraction of reads originating from an already-observed UMI. This is a function of library complexity and sequencing depth. More specifically, this is the fraction of confidently mapped, valid square-barcode, valid UMI reads that had a non-unique square-barcode/UMI/gene combination.

alert_warn_detail: At least one nucleus detected is larger than the maximum diameter of nuclei in pixels. Consider increasing the maximum nucleus diameter using the CLI parameter max_nucleus_diameter_px.
help_description: At least one nucleus detected is larger than the maximum diameter of nuclei in pixels. Consider increasing the maximum nucleus diameter using the CLI parameter max_nucleus_diameter_px.

alert_warn_detail: The automatic UMI-based registration could not determine a confident offset, so the position of the UMIs relative to the image has not been adjusted. If you do in fact observe misalignment between the high-resolution H&E and UMI images, please consider manually adjusting the alignment using the --umi-to-image-offset parameter.
help_description: full_name

alert_warn_detail: An error occured during the automatic UMI-based registration between the high-resolution H&E and UMI images and the results may be inaccurate. If you do in fact observe misalignment between the high-resolution H&E and UMI images, please consider manually adjusting the alignment using the --umi-to-image-offset parameter.
help_description: full_name

alert_warn_detail: Cell segmentation was enabled, but no cells with at least 1 UMI were detected. Please check your tissue detection, tissue registration and, if provided, your tissue selection Loupe file.
Cell segmentation was enabled, but no cells with at least 1 UMI were detected. Please check your tissue detection, tissue registration and, if provided, your tissue selection Loupe file.
help_description: full_name

alert_warn_detail: Ideal < 0.5μm/pixel. Microscope image pixel size is above the recommended threshold (0.5μm/pixel). Segmentation results may be less accurate. Verify that the image has not been downsampled.

key: # Things to take out from the SD Visium

alert_warn_detail: Ideal >20. This usually indicates poor tissue detection, poor library quality, or poor sequencing quality. Application performance is likely to be affected.
alert_warn_detail_cs: Ideal > 20. This usually indicates poor tissue detection, poor library quality, or poor sequencing quality. Application performance is likely to be affected.
help_description: The number of barcodes associated with a square under tissue.
The number of reads, both under and outside of tissue, divided by the number of barcodes associated with a square under tissue.
The number of reads, both under and outside of tissue, divided by the number of barcodes associated with a square under tissue.
The fraction of the squares under the tissue.

full_name: Mean Reads Under Tissue per Square
alert_warn_detail: Modifying the parameter --rps-limit is not recommended. Please refer to the documentation.
alert_warn_name: High Reads Under Tissue per Square
help_description: The number of reads under tissue divided by the number of barcodes associated with a square under tissue.
The median number of genes detected per square under tissue-associated barcode. Detection is defined as the presence of at least 1 UMI count.
The median number of UMI counts per tissue covered square.
The median number of genes detected per square under tissue-associated barcode. Detection is defined as the presence of at least 1 UMI count.
The median number of targeted UMI counts per tissue-associated barcode.
Number of genes with at least 10 filtered UMIs from tissue-associated barcodes. These genes are used to calculate per-gene enrichments.
